ch.bfh.btx8081.w2015.red.Schlurp.login

Class LoginValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.btx8081.w2015.red.Schlurp.login.LoginValidator

  • public class LoginValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    Checks if the login credentials(username, password) are correct, based on the file login.txt
    Version:
    V08.12.2015
    Author:
    Rea

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LoginValidator(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Constructor witch has to be constructed with the username and password.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.Boolean searchLoginCredentials(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      SearchLoginCredentials returns true, if the username is found at the first position of a line and the password at the second position of the same line.
      boolean validate()
      Invokes the method searchLoginCredentials.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LoginValidator

        public LoginValidator(java.lang.String username,
                      java.lang.String password)
        Constructor witch has to be constructed with the username and password.
        Parameters:
        username - the String that the user entered as username
        password - the String that the user entered as password

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public boolean validate()
        Invokes the method searchLoginCredentials. If that method returns false, it shows a notification that username/password is not correct. If it returns true, validate returns true too.
        Returns:
        a boolean

      • searchLoginCredentials

        public static java.lang.Boolean searchLoginCredentials(java.lang.String username,
                                                       java.lang.String password)
        SearchLoginCredentials returns true, if the username is found at the first position of a line and the password at the second position of the same line.
        Parameters:
        username - the String that the user entered as username
        password - the String that the user entered as password
        Returns:
        a boolean
